segment.source: Configure customization settings
segment.target: Configure customization settings

segment.source: Configure customization settings
segment.target: Configure customization settings

segment.source: Customizations are ways that you can modify the Windows device UI, connectivity settings, and user experience to better reflect your brand and to meet the requirements of the network and market in which the device will ship.
segment.target: Customizations are ways that you can modify the Windows device UI, connectivity settings, and user experience to better reflect your brand and to meet the requirements of the network and market in which the device will ship.

segment.source: Customizations can include adding apps, modifying the Start layout, configuring network settings using device management, changing the default values in the Settings screen, or adding new wallpapers.
segment.target: Customizations can include adding apps, modifying the Start layout, configuring network settings using device management, changing the default values in the Settings screen, or adding new wallpapers.

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile supports two customization frameworks: MCSF and Windows provisioning.
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile supports two customization frameworks: MCSF and Windows provisioning.

segment.source: For more information about each framework, see Customizations for mobile devices.
segment.target: For more information about each framework, see Customizations for mobile devices.

segment.source: In this section, we'll focus on adding the Start layout modification file, preloading an app, and configuring some customization settings using MCSF.
segment.target: In this section, we'll focus on adding the Start layout modification file, preloading an app, and configuring some customization settings using MCSF.

segment.source: For more detailed information about the various customizations you can do, see Customize using the mobile MCSF framework.
segment.target: For more detailed information about the various customizations you can do, see Customize using the mobile MCSF framework.

segment.source: Create an MCSF customization answer file
segment.target: Create an MCSF customization answer file

segment.source: You can use the MCSF customization answer file (CAF) to specify the settings and variants that you want to configure for a custom mobile OS image.
segment.target: You can use the MCSF customization answer file (CAF) to specify the settings and variants that you want to configure for a custom mobile OS image.

segment.source: Depending on the tools that you're using to build your image, you can use the MCSF CAF as input to ImgGen.cmd or the Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) CLI.
segment.target: Depending on the tools that you're using to build your image, you can use the MCSF CAF as input to ImgGen.cmd or the Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) CLI.

segment.source: This answer file is based on the MCSF schema so if you decide to use another schema, such as the Windows provisioning schema, you need to write a different answer file that follows that schema instead.
segment.target: This answer file is based on the MCSF schema so if you decide to use another schema, such as the Windows provisioning schema, you need to write a different answer file that follows that schema instead.

segment.source: If you don't have a pre-existing MCSF CAF, follow this walkthrough to learn how to create a basic MCSF CAF with multivariant support.
segment.target: If you don't have a pre-existing MCSF CAF, follow this walkthrough to learn how to create a basic MCSF CAF with multivariant support.

segment.source: Multivariant is the generic mechanism that lets you create a single image that can work for multiple markets by dynamically configuring the language, branding, apps, and networking settings during runtime based on the supported conditions, such as mobile operator and locale.
segment.target: Multivariant is the generic mechanism that lets you create a single image that can work for multiple markets by dynamically configuring the language, branding, apps, and networking settings during runtime based on the supported conditions, such as mobile operator and locale.

segment.source: If you are building a single variant image, you may skip this walkthrough.
segment.target: If you are building a single variant image, you may skip this walkthrough.

segment.source: To create the MCSF CAF with multivariant support
segment.target: To create the MCSF CAF with multivariant support

segment.source: Create an XML file and add the following content.
segment.target: Create an XML file and add the following content.

segment.source: Specify the values for the following attributes, which determines the owner for the customizations:
segment.target: Specify the values for the following attributes, which determines the owner for the customizations:

segment.source: Name - A string that specifies the name of the customization or package.
segment.target: Name - A string that specifies the name of the customization or package.

segment.source: You can specify the name based on the device you're configure, such as "XDeviceCustomizations", or a generic name like "MobileCustomizations".
segment.target: You can specify the name based on the device you're configure, such as "XDeviceCustomizations", or a generic name like "MobileCustomizations".

segment.source: Description - A string to help you identify the customizations defined within the CAF.
segment.target: Description - A string to help you identify the customizations defined within the CAF.

segment.source: Owner - A string specifying the owner, such as the OEM name.
segment.target: Owner - A string specifying the owner, such as the OEM name.

segment.source: OwnerType - Set this to "OEM".
segment.target: OwnerType - Set this to "OEM".

segment.source: Specify the Targets to use for the variants.
segment.target: Specify the Targets to use for the variants.

segment.source: Targets describe keying for a variant and must be described or pre-declared before being referenced by the variant.
segment.target: Targets describe keying for a variant and must be described or pre-declared before being referenced by the variant.

segment.source: To do this:
segment.target: To do this:

segment.source: To set up a Target
segment.target: To set up a Target

segment.source: Name the Target Id.
segment.target: Name the Target Id.

segment.source: Specify the Condition(s) for the target by providing the Name and Value.
segment.target: Specify the Condition(s) for the target by providing the Name and Value.

segment.source: For example, if we creating variants for two fictitious mobile operators, The Phone Company and Fabrikam, and we have their MCC and MNC, we can create a target for each operator using the MCC and MNC.
segment.target: For example, if we creating variants for two fictitious mobile operators, The Phone Company and Fabrikam, and we have their MCC and MNC, we can create a target for each operator using the MCC and MNC.

segment.source: To learn more about all the supported Condition Names that you can use, see the section Target, TargetState, Condition, and priorities in Create a provisioning package with multivariant settings.
segment.target: To learn more about all the supported Condition Names that you can use, see the section Target, TargetState, Condition, and priorities in Create a provisioning package with multivariant settings.

segment.source: Note that in this walkthrough we are not using a provisioning package to declare our multivariant settings; instead, we are adding this directly into the MCSF CAF.
segment.target: Note that in this walkthrough we are not using a provisioning package to declare our multivariant settings; instead, we are adding this directly into the MCSF CAF.

segment.source: Set up the variant.
segment.target: Set up the variant.

segment.source: To do this:
segment.target: To do this:

segment.source: To define a Variant
segment.target: To define a Variant

segment.source: Specify the Variant Name.
segment.target: Specify the Variant Name.

segment.source: Specify the TargetRef Id for the variant.
segment.target: Specify the TargetRef Id for the variant.

segment.source: This should match one of the Target Ids you specified in the Targets section of the CAF.
segment.target: This should match one of the Target Ids you specified in the Targets section of the CAF.

segment.source: Note that there should only be one TargetRef Id per variant.
segment.target: Note that there should only be one TargetRef Id per variant.

segment.source: Using our fictitious mobile operators, The Phone Company and Fabrikam, we can define the variants for each of these operators as shown in the following example:
segment.target: Using our fictitious mobile operators, The Phone Company and Fabrikam, we can define the variants for each of these operators as shown in the following example:

segment.source: Name and save the XML file; for example, C:ContosoCustomizationsMobileCustomizations.xml.
segment.target: Name and save the XML file; for example, C:ContosoCustomizationsMobileCustomizations.xml.

segment.source: We'll add the static (common or variant-agnostic) and variant-specific customization settings and values in the next walkthroughs.
segment.target: We'll add the static (common or variant-agnostic) and variant-specific customization settings and values in the next walkthroughs.

segment.source: Configure the Start layout
segment.target: Configure the Start layout

segment.source: In this section, we'll use the Start MCSF settings to add the Start layout modification files that you created in Configure the Start layout.
segment.target: In this section, we'll use the Start MCSF settings to add the Start layout modification files that you created in Configure the Start layout.

segment.source: We'll use one of the layout modification files as the common Start layout and we'll use the other layout modification file for one of the fictitious mobile operator variants.
segment.target: We'll use one of the layout modification files as the common Start layout and we'll use the other layout modification file for one of the fictitious mobile operator variants.

segment.source: Create and edit the MCSF CAF; for example, C:ContosoCustomizationsMobileCustomizations.xml.
segment.target: Create and edit the MCSF CAF; for example, C:ContosoCustomizationsMobileCustomizations.xml.

segment.source: Set C:ContosoCustomizationsLayoutModification1.xml as the common Start layout.
segment.target: Set C:ContosoCustomizationsLayoutModification1.xml as the common Start layout.

segment.source: Within the Static section of the CAF, set to the file path to the layout modification file.
segment.target: Within the Static section of the CAF, set to the file path to the layout modification file.

segment.source: By specifying a new default location for the LayoutModification.xml, you are overriding the default Start layout that's in C:DataProgramDataMicrosoftStartLayouts.
segment.target: By specifying a new default location for the LayoutModification.xml, you are overriding the default Start layout that's in C:DataProgramDataMicrosoftStartLayouts.

segment.source: Set C:ContosoCustomizationsLayoutModification2.xml as the default Start layout for the fictitious mobile operator, The Phone Company.
segment.target: Set C:ContosoCustomizationsLayoutModification2.xml as the default Start layout for the fictitious mobile operator, The Phone Company.

segment.source: In the Variant section named ThePhoneCompany, set to the file path for the second layout modification file.
segment.target: In the Variant section named ThePhoneCompany, set to the file path for the second layout modification file.

segment.source: Note is a FirstVariationOnly setting, which means that it can only be modified during first variation, which is typically when the first valid configuration is found (such as when a SIM is inserted and a marked configuration is found for the SIM).
segment.target: Note is a FirstVariationOnly setting, which means that it can only be modified during first variation, which is typically when the first valid configuration is found (such as when a SIM is inserted and a marked configuration is found for the SIM).

segment.source: If the configuration changes, such as during a SIM swap, the value for the FirstVariationOnly setting will not be changed again.
segment.target: If the configuration changes, such as during a SIM swap, the value for the FirstVariationOnly setting will not be changed again.

segment.source: In this example, when the device boots after flashing a new mobile image and there is no SIM is inserted into the mobile device or a SIM for the fictitious Fabrikam mobile operator (MCC=310, MNC=610) is already in the device, LayoutModification1.xml (Start layout with a folder) will be used.
segment.target: In this example, when the device boots after flashing a new mobile image and there is no SIM is inserted into the mobile device or a SIM for the fictitious Fabrikam mobile operator (MCC=310, MNC=610) is already in the device, LayoutModification1.xml (Start layout with a folder) will be used.

segment.source: If a SIM for the fictitious The Phone Company (MCC=410, MNC=510) is inserted after this, the Start layout will not change.
segment.target: If a SIM for the fictitious The Phone Company (MCC=410, MNC=510) is inserted after this, the Start layout will not change.

segment.source: However, if the device boots after flashing a new mobile image and there is already a SIM for The Phone Company inserted in the device, LayoutModification2.xml (Start layout with no folder) will be used instead.
segment.target: However, if the device boots after flashing a new mobile image and there is already a SIM for The Phone Company inserted in the device, LayoutModification2.xml (Start layout with no folder) will be used instead.

segment.source: Preload apps
segment.target: Preload apps

segment.source: Partners can preload apps to be packaged and configured to install on mobile devices during the initial device setup process.
segment.target: Partners can preload apps to be packaged and configured to install on mobile devices during the initial device setup process.

segment.source: In addition to preloading games, lifestyle apps, and other genres of apps, partners can preload system settings apps or partner account setup apps, just to name a few.
segment.target: In addition to preloading games, lifestyle apps, and other genres of apps, partners can preload system settings apps or partner account setup apps, just to name a few.

segment.source: For more information about preloading apps, see Preinstallable apps for mobile devices.
segment.target: For more information about preloading apps, see Preinstallable apps for mobile devices.

segment.source: Important In Windows 10, if you are working with an app developer or creating your own app to preload on the device, you must now request a preinstallation package for the app.
segment.target: Important In Windows 10, if you are working with an app developer or creating your own app to preload on the device, you must now request a preinstallation package for the app.

segment.source: For more information about this part of the process, see Generate preinstall packages for OEMs.
segment.target: For more information about this part of the process, see Generate preinstall packages for OEMs.

segment.source: The .zip file that's returned as part of this process should contain the app's source file (such as an .appx, .appxbundle, or .xap), a provisioning file (.provxml), and a license file (.xml).
segment.target: The .zip file that's returned as part of this process should contain the app's source file (such as an .appx, .appxbundle, or .xap), a provisioning file (.provxml), and a license file (.xml).

segment.source: If your preinstall package does not contain all of these files, you can't successfully preload the app.
segment.target: If your preinstall package does not contain all of these files, you can't successfully preload the app.

segment.source: To preload an app
segment.target: To preload an app

segment.source: Verify that the app preinstall package contains all the files you need to preload an app: source file, provisioning file, and license file.
segment.target: Verify that the app preinstall package contains all the files you need to preload an app: source file, provisioning file, and license file.

segment.source: Add the app to the image.
segment.target: Add the app to the image.

segment.source: To do this, follow these steps:
segment.target: To do this, follow these steps:

segment.source: Add an Applications section to the CAF.
segment.target: Add an Applications section to the CAF.

segment.source: Note You can add the Applications section within the Static section of the CAF, which means the app will be installed for all images regardless of the variant, or you can add it within a particular Variant, which means it will only be installed for a particular variant.
segment.target: Note You can add the Applications section within the Static section of the CAF, which means the app will be installed for all images regardless of the variant, or you can add it within a particular Variant, which means it will only be installed for a particular variant.

segment.source: If you are preloading more than one app, one can be common to all variants (or within the Static section), while another applies only to a particular variant (or within a Variant section).
segment.target: If you are preloading more than one app, one can be common to all variants (or within the Static section), while another applies only to a particular variant (or within a Variant section).

segment.source: An example of the latter case can be when you have an app that you only need to install for one particular mobile operator, or country/region, and so on.
segment.target: An example of the latter case can be when you have an app that you only need to install for one particular mobile operator, or country/region, and so on.

segment.source: Set Source to the location and name of your app source file; for example, C:ContosoCustomizationsAppsSampleApp.appx.
segment.target: Set Source to the location and name of your app source file; for example, C:ContosoCustomizationsAppsSampleApp.appx.

segment.source: Set License to the location and name of your app's license file; for example, C:ContosoCustomizationsAppsSampleAppLicense.xml.
segment.target: Set License to the location and name of your app's license file; for example, C:ContosoCustomizationsAppsSampleAppLicense.xml.

segment.source: Set ProvXML to the location and name of your app's provisioning file; for example, C:ContosoCustomizationsAppsmpapsampleapp001.provxml.
segment.target: Set ProvXML to the location and name of your app's provisioning file; for example, C:ContosoCustomizationsAppsmpapsampleapp001.provxml.

segment.source: The provXML file follows a prescribed naming convention.
segment.target: The provXML file follows a prescribed naming convention.

segment.source: See Preinstallable apps for mobile devices for more information.
segment.target: See Preinstallable apps for mobile devices for more information.

segment.source: Save the CAF when you are done adding all the apps.
segment.target: Save the CAF when you are done adding all the apps.

segment.source: In some cases, you may need to preload an app that has dependencies on other packages or components.
segment.target: In some cases, you may need to preload an app that has dependencies on other packages or components.

segment.source: In this case, you need to make sure that the other packages or components are preinstalled first before your app.
segment.target: In this case, you need to make sure that the other packages or components are preinstalled first before your app.

segment.source: If the dependent packages or components are not installed first, your app preload will fail.
segment.target: If the dependent packages or components are not installed first, your app preload will fail.

segment.source: We won't walk through this scenario here, but you can find this documented in Preload an app with a dependency.
segment.target: We won't walk through this scenario here, but you can find this documented in Preload an app with a dependency.

segment.source: Configure the DeviceTargetingInfo metadata for the device
segment.target: Configure the DeviceTargetingInfo metadata for the device

segment.source: In order to ship a mobile device, at a minimum, you must set the required settings described in Phone metadata in DeviceTargetingInfo.
segment.target: In order to ship a mobile device, at a minimum, you must set the required settings described in Phone metadata in DeviceTargetingInfo.

segment.source: Examples of required metadata include:
segment.target: Examples of required metadata include:

segment.source: OEM and mobile operator information, used for display strings in the UI, device update, connecting to the Windows Store, and so on.
segment.target: OEM and mobile operator information, used for display strings in the UI, device update, connecting to the Windows Store, and so on.

segment.source: Hardware component versions and software versions, used for targeting updates to devices and for user support.
segment.target: Hardware component versions and software versions, used for targeting updates to devices and for user support.

segment.source: The device's model name, the mobile operator's name, and the manufacturer's name, which appear in the About screen in Settings.
segment.target: The device's model name, the mobile operator's name, and the manufacturer's name, which appear in the About screen in Settings.

segment.source: To configure the DeviceTargetingInfo metadata
segment.target: To configure the DeviceTargetingInfo metadata

segment.source: Edit the MCSF CAF; for example, C:ContosoCustomizationsMobileCustomizations.xml.
segment.target: Edit the MCSF CAF; for example, C:ContosoCustomizationsMobileCustomizations.xml.

segment.source: Within the Static section of the CAF, add a settings group.
segment.target: Within the Static section of the CAF, add a settings group.

segment.source: These settings are image-time only and will be put directly into the registry hive.
segment.target: These settings are image-time only and will be put directly into the registry hive.

segment.source: Note that some settings in the group are optional so you may choose not to specify any values for them or remove them from the CAF.
segment.target: Note that some settings in the group are optional so you may choose not to specify any values for them or remove them from the CAF.

segment.source: The following table summarizes which settings are required, optional, and which ones come from the silicon vendor.
segment.target: The following table summarizes which settings are required, optional, and which ones come from the silicon vendor.

segment.source: Required setting
segment.target: Required setting

segment.source: Optional setting
segment.target: Optional setting

segment.source: SoC vendor setting
segment.target: SoC vendor setting

segment.source: PhoneManufacturer
segment.target: PhoneManufacturer

segment.source: PhoneFirmwareRevision
segment.target: PhoneFirmwareRevision

segment.source: PhoneROMLanguage
segment.target: PhoneROMLanguage

segment.source: PhoneHardwareVariant
segment.target: PhoneHardwareVariant

segment.source: PhoneManufacturerDisplayName
segment.target: PhoneManufacturerDisplayName

segment.source: PhoneRadioHardwareRevision
segment.target: PhoneRadioHardwareRevision

segment.source: PhoneROMVersion
segment.target: PhoneROMVersion

segment.source: PhoneHardwareRevision
segment.target: PhoneHardwareRevision

segment.source: PhoneSOCVersion
segment.target: PhoneSOCVersion

segment.source: PhoneRadioSoftwareRevision
segment.target: PhoneRadioSoftwareRevision

segment.source: PhoneBootLoaderVersion
segment.target: PhoneBootLoaderVersion

segment.source: Note You will need to contact your Microsoft representative to find out the value that you should use for .
segment.target: Note You will need to contact your Microsoft representative to find out the value that you should use for .

segment.source: Within the Variant section of the CAF, add a settings group.
segment.target: Within the Variant section of the CAF, add a settings group.

segment.source: Using our example, we'll add the settings within the variant section for ThePhoneCompany
segment.target: Using our example, we'll add the settings within the variant section for ThePhoneCompany

segment.source: These settings are first variation only and can be configured at runtime, so potentially may be based on the SIM value.
segment.target: These settings are first variation only and can be configured at runtime, so potentially may be based on the SIM value.

segment.source: Note that some settings in the group are optional so you may choose not to specify values for them or remove them from the CAF.
segment.target: Note that some settings in the group are optional so you may choose not to specify values for them or remove them from the CAF.

segment.source: The following table summarizes which settings are required, optional, and which ones come from the silicon vendor.
segment.target: The following table summarizes which settings are required, optional, and which ones come from the silicon vendor.

segment.source: Required setting
segment.target: Required setting

segment.source: Optional setting
segment.target: Optional setting

segment.source: PhoneMobileOperatorName
segment.target: PhoneMobileOperatorName

segment.source: PhoneManufacturerModelName
segment.target: PhoneManufacturerModelName

segment.source: PhoneModelName
segment.target: PhoneModelName

segment.source: PhoneMobileOperatorDisplayName
segment.target: PhoneMobileOperatorDisplayName

segment.source: PhoneSupportPhoneNumber
segment.target: PhoneSupportPhoneNumber

segment.source: PhoneSupportLink
segment.target: PhoneSupportLink

segment.source: PhoneOEMSupportLink
segment.target: PhoneOEMSupportLink

segment.source: PhoneRoamingSupportPhoneNumber
segment.target: PhoneRoamingSupportPhoneNumber

segment.source: Save the CAF when you are done adding all the values for the required settings or any optional settings you choose to set.
segment.target: Save the CAF when you are done adding all the values for the required settings or any optional settings you choose to set.

segment.source: Follow the guidance in Phone metadata in DeviceTargetingInfo to make sure you set the correct values and their formats.
segment.target: Follow the guidance in Phone metadata in DeviceTargetingInfo to make sure you set the correct values and their formats.

segment.source: Configure other customization settings
segment.target: Configure other customization settings

segment.source: There are a variety of other customization settings that you can configure for Windows mobile devices.
segment.target: There are a variety of other customization settings that you can configure for Windows mobile devices.

segment.source: For phones in particular, you'll also typically need to provision connectivity settings such as the MMS APN, MMS proxy, IMS services (if supported), and so on.
segment.target: For phones in particular, you'll also typically need to provision connectivity settings such as the MMS APN, MMS proxy, IMS services (if supported), and so on.

segment.source: For this walkthrough, we'll assume that you've already configured these settings so we won't cover how to configure these connectivity settings.
segment.target: For this walkthrough, we'll assume that you've already configured these settings so we won't cover how to configure these connectivity settings.

segment.source: The MCSF section of the partner documentation provides scenario-based documentation to help you identify the settings you need to configure based on the scenarios or areas you want to enable.
segment.target: The MCSF section of the partner documentation provides scenario-based documentation to help you identify the settings you need to configure based on the scenarios or areas you want to enable.

segment.source: For more information about these customizations, see:
segment.target: For more information about these customizations, see:

segment.source: Customizations for device management for info on overriding the default CountryTable.xml, setting the UICC slot for branding configuration, and more.
segment.target: Customizations for device management for info on overriding the default CountryTable.xml, setting the UICC slot for branding configuration, and more.

segment.source: Customizations for hardware components for info on customizing the display, storage, touch, and so on.
segment.target: Customizations for hardware components for info on customizing the display, storage, touch, and so on.

segment.source: Customizations for applications and Microsoft components for info on adding a phone call/SMS filter app, active phone cover settings, and others.
segment.target: Customizations for applications and Microsoft components for info on adding a phone call/SMS filter app, active phone cover settings, and others.

segment.source: Customizations for boot, initial setup, and shutdown to learn about configuring the timezone confirmation page and language selection during device setup, and many more.
segment.target: Customizations for boot, initial setup, and shutdown to learn about configuring the timezone confirmation page and language selection during device setup, and many more.

segment.source: Customizations for browser for info on ways you can customize Microsoft Edge.
segment.target: Customizations for browser for info on ways you can customize Microsoft Edge.

segment.source: Customizations for connectivity to learn more about setting the custom percentages for signal strength bars, preferred data provider list, roaming filter, and so on.
segment.target: Customizations for connectivity to learn more about setting the custom percentages for signal strength bars, preferred data provider list, roaming filter, and so on.

segment.source: Customizations for desktop experiences to customize the device icon and default image that appears when the mobile device is connected to the desktop.
segment.target: Customizations for desktop experiences to customize the device icon and default image that appears when the mobile device is connected to the desktop.

segment.source: Customizations for email to learn how to change the email app to always have a light background.
segment.target: Customizations for email to learn how to change the email app to always have a light background.

segment.source: Customizations for maps for info preloading map data in the user store or SD card, maps for phones shipped in China, and more.
segment.target: Customizations for maps for info preloading map data in the user store or SD card, maps for phones shipped in China, and more.

segment.source: Customizations for phone calls to learn about branding for phone calls, setting up visual voicemail, enabling IMS services and RCS, and many more.
segment.target: Customizations for phone calls to learn about branding for phone calls, setting up visual voicemail, enabling IMS services and RCS, and many more.

segment.source: Customizations for photos, music, and videos for info about audio volume limitation, adding OEM lens apps, and so on.
segment.target: Customizations for photos, music, and videos for info about audio volume limitation, adding OEM lens apps, and so on.

segment.source: Customizations for Settings to learn about all the many customizations you can configure for the settings that appear within the Settings app on mobile devices.
segment.target: Customizations for Settings to learn about all the many customizations you can configure for the settings that appear within the Settings app on mobile devices.

segment.source: Customizations for SMS and MMS for more info on adding encoding extension tables for SMS, maximum length for messages, intercept deny list, and many more.
segment.target: Customizations for SMS and MMS for more info on adding encoding extension tables for SMS, maximum length for messages, intercept deny list, and many more.

segment.source: Customizations for Start to change the default behavior of the Windows Store live tile.
segment.target: Customizations for Start to change the default behavior of the Windows Store live tile.

segment.source: Note that you may configure the Start layout too, but that's covered in Start layout for Windows 10 mobile editions and shown as an example in this walkthrough.
segment.target: Note that you may configure the Start layout too, but that's covered in Start layout for Windows 10 mobile editions and shown as an example in this walkthrough.
